This game has come a long way since its inception. 
Online based play style which can be good or bad depending on the survivors you pair with, or killer. Sometimes match making isn't perfect and one side gets completely wiped. It's best to play this game with friends I find. I would prefer to play online with 3 other friends than random survivors as you deal with people disconnecting all the time over trivial things. And. Well. I would prefer a game where everyone tries until the end. 

What keeps me continuing in this game is there are a lot of side objectives to choose from. So even though you hit a point where the game can get grindy, there is something to always continue working towards which makes the pain of grinding just a little more softer.

This review is from the perspective of a survivor main. This game is far from perfect. When you have a bad match, it's REALLY bad. Being targeted by the killer has to be one of the most frustrating gaming experiences out there. The game suffers from attempting to be both a competitive multiplayer game and a horror experience, never reaching the full potential of either (for reference I would prefer if it was a stronger horror experience). Playing the game over long periods of time only highlights its frustrations.

That said, when the game is good, it's REALLY good. Escaping as the last survivor by the skin of your teeth is one of the most exhilarating experiences gaming can offer. It's the premier asymmetrical video game, reaching a balance that, although not perfect, allows both sides to have a shot at victory. The game has an alluring quality, and there are simply no other games that can match it in what it does best. I recommend this game to literally anyone who is looking for something different in the online multiplayer arena.

5/5

The worst community in any online game, by far. Absolutely no moderation from the company who made the game. Neo-nazis spouting anti-jewish hate in pre and post game chat without any action from the company who made the game. Players deliberately ruining your game experience, game after game, without any action from the company who made the game. I wouldn't recommend anyone buy this game for any reason. The company who makes the game spends absolutely zero dollars moderating behavior from players.

Used to love this game so much. I am sticking in this game from the very beginning and having so much fun. Until now, this game is full of toxic and trolling players from the survivors to killers. As far as I knew, the report button just nothing than for easing your frustating at the end of the game. If the dev did not do anything of those toxic players, there will be more players leaving this game. I can see this results as the matchmaking time is longer than it used to be like about 5-10 mins for the green rank survivors at weekends night. It is really sad to admit that but DBD is getting to be the dead game not because of the base gameplay but because of the community.
Buen juego de supervivencia. puedes tomar el rol de asesino o jugar con tus amigos de superviviente, variedad de mapas y algunos personajes de peliculas de terror.

This game overall is good, but the developers are poor at actually satisfying the community. The game's aspect is great, they have a good "paper-down" ideology of how the game should run, but don't have the courtesy to "perfect?" it. I know games are going to include bugs, glitches, etc, but this game is built off of bugs. There is so many times where I sat in distraught because the killer hit me when I am completely off the vault and I am far away, or they hit me when I am far away. But overall, this game is great to play with your friends, and if you're competitive, I guess this game is for you? But if you are more of a casual gamer, then don't play so hard because you'll rank up and play against the people who compete.

I love/hate this game, it can make you want to died or make you happier than ever. Your early game as a killer is easy but the more you play the more toxic and mean the survivors get but as you learn to counter there play style the game can be vary fun. As a survivor you will prob be sitting in a locker all game for your first 50hrs but soon will be looping killers and flashlight flickering them. then one of three things will happen you will be a toxic bad survivor for ever, you will get better and better at the game slowly realizing that you sucked so you be nicer to the killer and actually get good at the game, or you will be a bad survivor that never looks behind them and dies in chase in 2secs but you will LOVE to hold M1 on a gen for the whole match and as long as you never get chased your teammates will love you. If you want to be apart of a toxic, nice, mean, fun, bad, cool, community then DBD is perfect for you! oh and this game is VARY pay to win as killer and just a little as survivor. because every killer has a different power and you have to pay for some and you will have to use your hard earned money on a ass killer in a ass game JUST SO YOU CAN GET BBQ AND STBFL AND BW AND EVERY SINGLE LICENCED KILLER PERK. for the most fun DBD experience you have to play survivor because killer will just want to make you kill your self. SO have fun playing the best game ever DBD :)

It's an experience. Community is toxic as hell though. And there is balancing issues.

In the words of Ochiido: "Pretty good job so far" -_- Yea right, the state of the game is horrendous. Someone pointed out that the devs basically don't care and I'm very much inclined to agree. The community is overly toxic and it seems like whenever you run into a "twitch" streamer and if you do something they don't like, they call their sheep to report you through any means. Whether you're playing the killer with a certain build, or a have a certain perk (NoED), or playing survivor and get called out for having Decisive Strike. Like back when DbD was still fresh out of development, yes it was plagued with bugs, but at least it was fun because it was myself and a few other friends discovering it for the first time and actually having fun with it.

Now it's just bloated with useless perks, microtransactions, toxic communities, $120 worth of extra crap that should either be included with the full game or consolidated into packs, and sweaty players making it a habit to hit rank 1 all the time and make you feel inferior because you're not rank 1. So for anyone new who wants to play this game, I highly recommend not playing it, not until the devs actually start listening and actually start doing what they said in the first place and taking care of the community built around their game.

Edit 1: This game 100% got worse the minute they allowed cross play with the scrub console players.
